intro: Holosteum umbellatum var. hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy holosteum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, giving it its varietal name "hirsutum." Its small white or greenish flowers are typically arranged in umbrella-like clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
